model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Neighbors B, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Neighbors A: Hey neighbor, have you noticed how strong I've become?
Neighbors B: Wow, you do look very strong! Have you been working out?
Neighbors A: Yes, I go to the gym every day and lift weights. It's been really helping me build muscle.
Neighbors B: That's great to hear! It reminds me of the time when you apologized to me for the way you treated me.
Neighbors A: Yes, I realized that I needed to take responsibility for my actions and I didn't want to make the same mistake again.
Neighbors B: It's always important to own up to our mistakes. It's like when you forgot your backpack in high school and had to deal with the consequences.
Neighbors A: Definitely. It taught me to always be prepared and double-check everything. It's like how I make sure to tighten screws and wires when working on my computer.

[MEMORY]
Neighbors A and B discussed the importance of taking care of trees and the environment for future generations. This led to Neighbor B accepting Neighbor A's apology and mentioning how hurtful it was to be treated poorly. In response, Neighbors A apologized to Neighbors B, admitted their mistake, and expressed a desire to make amends.

The conversation about the environment continued with Neighbor A apologizing to Neighbor B and showing a willingness to make things right. This triggered Neighbors B to remind Neighbor A about the importance of taking responsibility for past mistakes and learning from them. As a result, Neighbor A apologized again and acknowledged their wrongdoing.

Building on the theme of environmental care, Neighbor A apologized to Neighbor B and expressed a desire to make amends. This prompted Neighbors B to suggest talking to the teacher so Neighbor A could potentially take a test on another day.

prediction:

Judgement: Yes
